headings.value: Add data sources to Apollo Server

children.value: Now that we've constructed our schema, we need to connect data sources to Apollo Server.
A data source is any database, service, or API that holds the data you use to populate your schema's fields.
Your GraphQL API can interact with any combination of data sources.
class that we can extend to handle interaction logic for a particular type of data source. In this section, we'll extend
to connect both a REST API and a SQL database to Apollo Server. Don't worry, you don't need to be familiar with either of these technologies to follow along with the examples.

class is complete! Next, let's connect a database to our server.
The SpaceX API is a read-only data source for fetching launch data. We also need a
data source that allows us to store application data, such as user identities and seat reservations. To accomplish this, we'll connect to a SQLite database and use Sequelize for our ORM. Our

children.value: Add data sources to Apollo Server
Now that we've built our two data sources, we need to add them to Apollo Server.

Now that we've hooked up our data sources to Apollo Server, it's time to move on to the next section and learn how to interact with our data sources from within our resolvers.
